intro: Ovieda fabricii, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its milky sap contains toxic compounds, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Ovieda fabricii is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
